server_costs.title: Server Costs
server_costs.description: Hi, viddie here. Unsurprisingly, running servers costs money, and while I can pour in as much time as I like into creating this project, someone has to pay to keep the server running. This website does not (and will never) have ADs. I am willing to pay for the server costs all by myself if necessary, but if anyone in the community wants to help me out, I would gladly appreciate it!

costs_so_far.title: Costs So Far
costs_so_far.description: The server has been running since April, 2024. That's {{months}} months so far.
costs_so_far.not_lose: This is the amount of € that I need to not lose money

stocked_up.title: Stocked Up

rules.title: Rules
rules.description: This page exists mostly as a formalization of rules and edge cases for said rules. The most basic form of requied submission rules is "don't cheat, don't use gameplay-altering mods, have a full session recording for challenges harder than tier 3, and make sure to show the end screen". However, this formalization exists to cover potential confusion for certain edge cases and all the like. This list isn't exhaustive. It can't be. Mappers come up with ways to subvert our expectations all the time, and if we tried to formalize the minefield that it is, we would get nowhere. If you have an edge case not covered by this list, or general questions about it, please ask us! Ask us before you make a submission that results in days of debate that may or may not result in it getting rejected. Thank you.

rules.0: The map or map pack must be uploaded to GameBanana. If a map was previously on GameBanana but taken down afterwards, it will be uploaded to this archive.org item unless the map creator specifically requests to remove its downloadability.
rules.1: The map or map pack must contain a challenge that poses a non-trivial amount of danger, even if that danger may be small. Maps where all challenges contain little to no danger will be rejected. An example of a map that, while difficult, does not meet the danger requirement is Ultra Skrimbles. In rare circumstances, usually when a map is part of a more complete campaign or lobby, exceptions will be made, such as for Summit Down-Side Silver. Maps with this property will be labeled as "Trivial".
rules.2: The map or map pack must be at least two gameplay screens or checkpoints in length. Otherwise, any challenges within a map would be identical to a clear.
rules.3: The map or map pack must not contain adult or offensive content. This includes, but is not limited to, nudity, pornography, gore, extreme fetish material, or offensive statements or depictions of a protected minority.
rules.4: The map or map pack is recommended to not resemble a base game map or an existing custom map to a high degree. For some examples, unique map packs such as Etselec or more thoughtful, usually more difficult edits such as Farewell^9 are acceptable, while maps such as 1a Undefined are likely to be rejected.
rules.5: Challenges in a map pack must not involve activities performed outside of Celeste. An example of such a case is The Golden Challenge.

rules.0: The submission video must be uploaded to a permanent place that does not require an account to view. The most popular sites for such videos are YouTube, Twitch, bilibili, and nicovideo, but sites outside of these are perfectly fine to be submitted. A messaging service CDN (i.e. cdn.discordapp.com or similar) is not accepted for submissions. A link that is able to expire by virtue of time only (i.e. 0x0.st links) is not accepted for submissions.
rules.1: The submission video must show the complete achievement of the challenge, e.g. from obtaining the golden strawberry to when the golden strawberry collects. It is not necessary that one must stay alive after the completion of the challenge but before exiting the map (e.g. "Heart Deaths", an example of which can be found in the golden of Magnetic Dawn B-Side). Note that a golden strawberry collecting may not always be the end of a challenge, such as a berry remaining in a full clear challenge, as is the case for Anubi Full Clear. Exceptions to this are very rare and evaluated on a case-by-case basis, such as a livestream cutting out for a brief moment, so long as the circumstances and player are deemed trustworthy.
rules.2: Submissions must be done in one continuous play session.
rules.3: Submissions must not make use of gameplay-altering mods, variants, or assist mode outside what is allowed by the map. Visual-altering mods and variants may be allowed on a case-by-case basis. See allowed and recommended mods for more details.
rules.4: Submissions for challenges as or more difficult than Tier 3 must have a recording of a full session. In the event that the submission was done near the beginning of the session, a request for a previous session recording may be asked.
rules.5: Submissions are recommended to not make use of "info mods" which give you information that you otherwise would not know during gameplay, such as input history, stamina bar, or CelesteTAS's info HUD. On challenges where these make little to no difference, submissions will be accepted without issue. On challenges or submissions where these make a difference, such as subpixel-level alignment, stamina-heavy challenges, or gauging information to perform a strat or save, submissions will be rejected.
rules.6: Submissions must not abuse the use of pause buffering, wherein the pause button is "buffered" between pauses to advance the game frame-by-frame. Pause buffering can make tight inputs in a map extremely easy, and use of it is grounds for rejection. There exist submissions, mainly before 1.4, where buffering the pause button became possible, that include something similar to pause buffering, but these submissions did not rely on buffering the pause button, which made them allowed.
rules.7: Submissions must not abuse spinner freezing, where the player waits ~118 hours ingame to prevent certain spinners from loading. Submissions may utilize the technique known as spinner stunning due to its extreme frame-perfect nature and general unviability for goldens. For more info on these techniques, check out the video on them by EuniverseCat.
rules.8: If a map does not have a golden strawberry, one is allowed to use the console command give_golden to give themselves a golden strawberry. This command must be used in the first room of the map at a place trivially accessible from chapter restart. Alternatively, one may use Ahorn or Lönn to add a golden strawberry in the first room of the map at a place trivially accessible from chapter restart.
rules.9: For golden strawberry (or other similar berry) submissions, the submission does not have to actually collect the berry so long as the run follows the same challenge requirements (A.K.A. a deathless berryless run). Runs where a golden strawberry is fundamentally different than a non-golden, such as a golden room, will most likely not be accepted in this manner. While of course discouraged and we urge submissions to collect the applicable berry, we also understand that sometimes things happen and people unexpectedly fluke, and we don't want that to take away from anyone's achievement. Deathless berryless submissions will be given a note.
rules.10: For golden strawberry (or other similar berry) submissions, submissions may edit the end of a map to add a golden collect trigger if and only if a golden collect trigger does not exist. If a crystal heart indicates the ending but doesn't kick the player out, editing it to kick the player out is fine. This will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, as this is very rare.
rules.11: For golden strawberry (or other similar berry) submissions, submissions are allowed to die during map intentional golden strawberry detachments as many times as one would like. This does not apply to golden detachments made to fix an issue (such as in A Beautiful Meadow) or unintentional golden detachments.
rules.12: Submissions must show the end screen of a map upon completing the challenge. If an end screen does not exist, the journal must be shown immediately after exiting. This rule is more loosely applied to standard difficulty goldens, but is more enforced for higher difficulty goldens.
rules.13: Submissions must follow the bounds of progression existing within the challenge. If a challenge involves global flags or other things existing outside the scope of the challenge, it can be assumed that they are unlocked. If it is significant enough, challenges may be separated based on these flags.
rules.14: Submissions must not have an overlay covering a large amount or essential parts of the screen. Essential parts include the timer, the total berry count in the top left, the pause menu berry tracker, the player, and the save icon in the bottom right.

full_game_additional.header: Additional Rules for Full Game Submissions
full_game_additional.explanation: There are two types of "full game" submissions: ones that complete a relevant subset of all maps in a map pack (which will be referred to as partial full game runs), such as all c-sides deathless or beginner lobby deathless, and complete full game runs, such as all maps deathless or 100% deathless. Rules which apply to only a specific category of these will be indicated.
full_game_additional.0: The submission video must show the run in full. For a partial full game run, the video must start at or before the chapter select screen of the first map completed and end after completing the final map. For a complete full game run, the video must start at or before the file select screen and end after completing the final map.
full_game_additional.1: As a reminder, or if one is only looking at this section of the rules, rule #14 in the list for all submissions explains how one should treat progression for challenges, which includes full game challenges. In general, full game submissions must start from what is effectively a new save file, while partial full game submissions can vary. For an example, consider the vanilla game. If one were to do all A-Sides deathless, they must be done in order, as 1a unlocks 2a, 2a unlocks 3a, etc. If one were to do all B-Sides deathless, they can be done in any order, as unlocking them is irrespective of progression within the B-Sides themselves. If one were to do 100% deathless, it must be done from a new file.
full_game_additional.2: Submissions must not use "Return to Map" or any similar option to reset the state of a room. The state of a room includes, but is not limited to: player position, one-time dash crystals, falling blocks, kevin positions, switches, etc.
full_game_additional.3: Submissions must not utilize more than one save file in any form.
full_game_additional.4: If the run has forced deaths (e.g. a Farewell-esque moon berry), runs are allowed to die in such instances, but no more than the minimum required to pass the section. Do note that this is different than if one was doing the map alone deathless, as described in rule #12.
full_game_additional.5: Submissions must have the "File Timer" enabled, not just the chapter timer.
full_game_additional.6: Submissions are recommended to not take long or frequent breaks on the menu or pause screen. It is more acceptable to take breaks while inside a map and not paused, though taking frequent breaks might raise suspicion and request for more proof.
full_game_additional.7: If a submission does not collect golden/silver berries, it may be submitted for individual map runs on the respective sheet if the challenge follows the same aforementioned rule about deathless berryless runs.

section.explanation: These aren't exactly rules that need to be followed, but they help in aiding proof strength, avoiding giving your submission a note, helping one complete a challenge, or is a general courteous decision for others.
section.0: Using the chapter or file timer will help credibility, but it is not required for single-map submissions. Recall that file timer is required for full game submissions.
section.1: Using an external input display, such as <CustomExternalLink href="https://github.com/ThoNohT/NohBoard">NohBoard</CustomExternalLink> for Windows, <CustomExternalLink href="https://github.com/yoshiyoshyosh/kbdisplay">kbdisplay</CustomExternalLink> for Linux (X11), or <CustomExternalLink href="https://github.com/RoanH/KeysPerSecond">KeysPerSecond</CustomExternalLink> for cross-platform, will help credibility. One may also use the <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/34273">Input History</CustomExternalLink> mod as an input display provided that the settings for showing frame counts or history of inputs is are disabled.
section.2: Keep a few full session runs on hand, especially for high tier goldens, in the event that a verifier requests more proof than what is required.

section.explanation: All mods listed here are allowed for submissions unless otherwise specified. Mods not listed here are also allowed for submissions unless they violate the gameplay altering mod rule or info gaining mod rule.
section.0: The No Freeze Frames variant in Extended Variants is allowed for submissions. The rationale is that this mod does not fundamentally change the game as well as makes the game harder in most instances, as well as bearing the weight of legacy runs that utilized this variant.
section.1: The <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/421816">Deadzone Config</CustomExternalLink> mod allows individuals using a controller to configure their deadzone, most notably to make fastfalling and other awkward diagonal inputs easier.
section.2: For complete full game runs, using the <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/53679">Hardcore Mode</CustomExternalLink> mod may help reset runs faster, but is not required. Hardcore mode will also allow goldens to spawn without needing cheat mode, which means the full game run may be submitted to individual maps without issue.
section.3: The <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/363600">Golden QOL</CustomExternalLink> mod is allowed for submissions. This mod gives players some helpful quality of life features, such as making the golden berry transparent, being able to place a persistent golden berry without using a map editor, or allowing one to start at the same room they died in a golden run.
section.4: The <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/tools/6597">Speedrun Tool</CustomExternalLink> mod and <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/tools/6715">CelesteTAS</CustomExternalLink> mods can help finding strategies and setups for parts in a challenge. Do note, however, that utilizing any gameplay-altering of info-gaining features of these mods during a challenge is disallowed.
section.5: Other mods frequently used for deathless challenges include <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/358978">Consistency Tracker</CustomExternalLink> and <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/53681">DeathTracker</CustomExternalLink>.

0.question: Can I submit maps that aren't in the list yet?
0.answer: Yes, you can submit a golden for a map that isn't in the list yet. In this case you must also provide a link to the map and make sure that the map follows all the rules. But even if it does, we may not add it to the list for certain reasons which we will specify in the page with rejected maps.

1.question: Are demodash buttons/multiple jump binds allowed?
1.answer: Demodash buttons and multiple jump binds are allowed. The same goes for any combination of inputs that can be mapped on the same key/button, but external macros which press multiple inputs on different frames are not allowed.

2.question: What is the criteria for getting a full clear?
2.answer: Because of how different maps this can, this has the potential to vary. The most basic form of a full clear is obtaining all collectibles that do not represent a different challenge than the one being performed. For example, consider a map that has red berries, a cassette, a crystal heart, and a dashless golden berry. If one were to perform a full clear of the map, they would be required to collect the red berries, the cassette, and the crystal heart. The dashless golden berry represents a different challenge--doing the map dashless--and thus is not needed for a full clear. If it is impossible to get all the collectibles dashless, the dashless challenge would not contain a full clear flag. If it is possible, both the normal challenge and the dashless challenge will have full clear flags.

3.question: Why are some maps ineligible for full clear runs?
3.answer: Some maps have collectibles which are not optional, such as the strawberries in Hell Gym.

4.question: What is the Top Golden List Rankings?
4.answer: The Top Golden List Rankings is a list of the hardest golden strawberry clears, where the minimum requirement to get on the list is to be harder than 'Hell Trio' from vanilla, which are the B-Side golden strawberries of chapters 6, 7, and 8. These are ordered by tier, so each color represents a different tier, and the higher up on the list means the harder it is. Please note that these are all decided subjectively by people with experience on the goldens, so these won't be perfectly accurate, and shouldn't be treated as such. The fewer people with the golden the more possible variance there is, so less popular goldens are more likely to be more inaccurate. It's intended to be our best estimate based on what the people who have done the goldens so far have said, so they're subject to change if and when more people do them. People generally try to base off a few things: their total playtime/experience with the game at the time of the golden, how much time they took on the map individually, and a more subjective analysis of the map's length, difficulty distribution, and gameplay consistency, among other things.

welcome.text: The main goal of this website is to maintain all the deathless clears of maps or campaigns, as well as motivating people to go for deathless challenges and making the deathless completion scene of Celeste more active in general. The website shows all the maps that have been completed without dying, as well as names of people who did the goldens.
welcome.info: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to join the Modded Golden Team Discord server and ask there, or contact any of the team members directly.

links.survivors_list: Celeste Survivors List (Deathless runs of vanilla Celeste)

issues.text: If you find any issues, please report them by either creating a <CustomExternalLink href="https://github.com/yoshiyoshyosh/goldberries/issues">new issue on GitHub</CustomExternalLink> or by @-ing viddie in the Modded Golden Team Discord server, preferably in the <CustomExternalLink href="https://discord.com/channels/790156040653897749/1269306272776458321">dedicated channel</CustomExternalLink> for this website

totals.campaigns: {{campaigns}} campaigns ({{standalone}} of them are stand-alone maps)

difficulty_stats.text: Number of submissions in each tier

getting_started.preface: To make a submission to this website, you need to do the following:
getting_started.video: Have video proof of your deathless run, uploaded to a permanent place (e.g. YouTube, bilibili, ...)
getting_started.account: Register an account and login to your account. You can sign-up via Discord or email address & password
getting_started.player: Claim a player. If you already had submissions on the spreadsheet your "player" will already exist, and you need to claim it for yourself. If this is your first submission, you can create a new player for yourself.
getting_started.submit: Read the <RulesLink>rules</RulesLink>, head over to <CustomLink>the submit page</CustomLink> and make your submission!

newly_released.text: This website has just recently been released! Given the chaotic state of data on the spreadsheet, it's to be expected that there will be wrong or inconsistent data somewhere. When you spot some, please report it in the Modded Golden Team Discord server!
newly_released.migration: Migrating all of the data, as well as the entire community over to this website will take a while, so for the time being you can still make your submissions the old-fashioned way, by tagging the modded golden team in the Celeste Discord server, or the Modded Golden Team Discord server.

credits.title: Credits
credits.text: This page lists all contributors to the website
credits.people: many many wonderful people from the goldberries-net thread in the Modded Golden Team Discord

historical_clears.label: Historical Clears
historical_clears.text: These charts show the number of clears for each tier for every month since the beginning of the list.

most_goldened.label: Most Goldened
most_goldened.text: These are the campaigns and maps with the most amount of submissions.
most_goldened.time_machine: Select a date below to see the most goldened campaigns and maps at that time.

submissions.text: There have been {{count}} submissions since the website was released on the 2nd of August 2024

difficulties.text: For each tier, the percentage of players who have done at least one golden in that tier.
